intro: Piaranthus cornutus var. ruschii, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb that produces a basal rosette of fleshy, narrow leaves. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
